title: About the UK Pavilion at Astana Expo 2017

details.body:
UKTI has recently launched an open competition to create a stand-out Pavilion inspired by the theme of ‘Future Energy’. The winner of the competition will be announced in June 2016. The Pavilion will form the platform for a three month programme of business, cultural and thought leadership events.

Opportunities

We are keen for businesses from a wide range of backgrounds to get involved in the UK Pavilion. There are many ways to get involved:

Sponsorship

Sponsors are key to the delivery of the UK Pavilion. Through sponsorship, your business can gain visibility, access to the Pavilion for corporate use as well as a range of other benefits. If you are interested in sponsorship, contact Steven Anderson, Head of Sponsorship.

Exhibiting

There are opportunities for UK companies to exhibit at the Pavilion on all things energy. Being an exhibitor at the Expo is an effective way to showcase your company’s capabilities and engage with an international audience. If you are interested in exhibiting, contact Steve Jewitt-Fleet, Head of Partnerships.

Events

We will have a comprehensive events programme in place in Astana, with the opportunity for partners to host a range of events including networking receptions and thought leadership forums. If you are interested in participating, contact Steve Jewitt-Fleet, Head of Partnerships.

Business Partnering

If you are looking to export to Kazakhstan in advance of the Expo, UKTI can give support and further advice. For more information, please see Exporting to Kazakhstan.

Media enquiries

For specific media enquiries please email AstanaExpo2017@ukti.gsi.gov.uk. Please note, this address is for media enquiries only.

description: The UK’s participation is led by the Astana Expo Team in UK Trade and Investment (UKTI).

available_translations.title: About the UK Pavilion at Astana Expo 2017
available_translations.description: The UK’s participation is led by the Astana Expo Team in Department for International Trade (DIT).
